newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador's Bucaram postpones address to 2000 GMT.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador's Bucaram postpones address to 2000 GMT.

text.p: Ecuador's President Abdala Bucaram will address the nation at 3 p.m. (2000 GMT), presidential sources said Thursday.
The speech was earlier scheduled for 1 P.M. (1800 GMT).
The sources gave no reason for the postponement of the address, which will deal with Ecuador's social crisis.

Unions Thursday staged the second day of a general strike against tough austerity measures and Congress was due to meet at 1800 local time (2300 GMT), amid speculation that legislators might try to dismiss Bucaram.
